page.title: 03LANGTON VILLAGE.
page.content: Langton has been voted one of the prettiest villages in{YORKSHIRE.}It's small,arched windows and fanlights,set in slate-roofed stone houses are made from locally quarried{LIMESTONE.}They stand alongside the road and around the Cherry tree-lined 'Green.In the 1800's these were Estate worker's homes.Many are still rented from the Estate.The old school was just 45 sq.m approx!The village has been well kept and has changed little since being re-built between 1820 and 1840. More recent buildings have been made to blend with the older cottages. {St.ANDREW'S CHURCH}remains but the old Chapel and Blacksmith's shop have gone although "CHAPEL ROW" cottages are still occupied.Beech,Elm and Sycamore grow in the village which now has a small Primary School and,at{LANGTON {HALL,}a Private Preparatory school.
